Documentation for the Code¶

class pyspark_histogram.pyspark_histogram.Histogram(nr_bins=10, min_bin=None, max_bin=None, bins=None, use_log10=False)[source]¶

The Histogram object leverages Spark to calculate histograms, and matplotlib to visualize these.

Args:

nr_bins (int, optional): Number of bins in the histogram. Defaults to 10. min_bin (int, optional): Minimum value of the lowest bin in the histogram. All values lower

then this value are not included in the histogram. Defaults to None (all values are included).
max_bin (int, optional): Maximum value of the highest bin in the histogram. All values higher
then this value are not included in the histogram. Defaults to None (all values are included).
bins ((list of str, optional): Predefined list of bin boundaries. Defaults to None.
The bins are all open to the right except for the last which is closed. e.g. [1,10,20,50] means the buckets are [1,10) [10,20) [20,50], which means 1<=x<10, 10<=x<20, 20<=x<=50.
